meanings.sent1: The small shop had to close down because it was uneconomic to keep it open.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to shut down the uneconomic factory to save money.
meanings.sent3: It was uneconomic to buy a new car just for a short trip to the grocery store.
meanings.sent4: The old heating system was so uneconomic that it felt like burning money.
meanings.sent5: Trying to run a business without a clear plan is like sailing a ship in an uneconomic storm.

meanings.definition: Not efficient or practical in terms of cost.
meanings.sent1: The uneconomic car used up too much gas for its size.
meanings.sent2: Using a leaky faucet is uneconomic as it wastes water and money.
meanings.sent3: It was uneconomic to keep the lights on in an empty room all day.
meanings.sent4: The old computer was so uneconomic that it took ages to load a simple webpage.
meanings.sent5: Wearing a heavy coat in the summer is as uneconomic as carrying a rock in your pocket.
